distorted adjective
(OUT OF SHAPE)

distorted adjective
(FALSE)
false or wrong: This report gives a somewhat distorted impression of what actually happened. We have a distorted belief that we are more ethical than we really are. Because of a distorted body image, she believes that she's overweight even when she is underweight.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople generally have a distorted view of the past.The extreme sentiments described in the article are a distorted description of the general mood.People who are mentally ill sometimes interpret events in a distorted way.

distorted adjective
(SOUND)
If a sound produced on electrical equipment is distorted, it sounds strange and unpleasant because of changes in the shape of the sound wave: The music just gets distorted when you play it so loud. A distorted synthesized voice came from the speakers.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sound is all distorted.He modernized the sound with a distorted electric guitar.
